acknowledgements: {"blocks":[{"key":"b0vig","text":"We acknowledge prior optimizations made by the labs of Steve McCarroll and Evan Macosko (Broad Institute) for high-quality single nucleus RNA-seq from frozen tissue and brain. These include use of 1% Triton and Kollidon VA-64 in the sample homogenization buffer. The low level of centrifugation was incorporated from a protocol by the Mukamel and Zeng groups. We also acknowledge members of the Corces lab (Gladstone Institutes) and the Howard Chang/William Greenleaf labs (Stanford University) for prior protocol optimizations for ATAC-seq.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"i4au","text":"This protocol enables the isolation of nuclei from frozen tissues for use in downstream single-nucleus Multiome (paired ATAC-seq and RNA-seq) experiments. These nuclei are suitable for use in bulk ATAC-seq, single-nucleus ATAC-seq, single-nucleus RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, HiC/MicroC, among other assays. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3l8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8s0o","text":"For single-nucleus Multiome and RNA-seq experiments we recommend addition of RNase inhibitor to the solutions and addition of Triton X-100 and Kollidon VA-64 to the homogenization buffer. These additions were strongly based on nuclei extraction protocols from the McCarroll and Macosko laboratories (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bi62khge). Additions of RNase inhibitor and Kollidon VA-64 are only required for single-nucleus RNA-seq and single-nucleus Multiome workflows.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":300,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ADA00D72001411EF91370A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bi62khge"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3r26k","text":"The quality of the tissue at the time of freezing is a major factor in the quality of data downstream. If freezing tissue for use later, you may want to consider cryopreserving 50 mg tissue chunks in BAM Banker cryopreservative. If using previously frozen tissue, the ischemic time or post mortem interval should be kept as short as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blep2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avbv5","text":"Nuclei can be cryopreserved in BAM Banker. In our experience, each freeze-thaw cycle results in minor decreases in single nucleus Multiome data quality. Ensure that thawing is carried out on ice and freezing is performed using a slow-freeze freezing container. We have had success isolating nuclei from every tissue we have tried including difficult to work with tissues such as heart.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: ATAC-seq, Nuclei Isolation, Frozen Tissue Homogenization

steps.section: Before you start the protocol:
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"25rpc","text":"All steps should be performed on ice or at  . Pre-chill a swinging bucket centrifuge and a fixed angle centrifuge to   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"968h0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"1168EDB0C85711E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"13619","label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Before you start the protocol:
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"82ko6","text":"Pre-chill all Dounces and pestles to   in a fridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0F80F3D0C85711E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"13620","label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Before you start the protocol:
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6nv22","text":"Pre-chill all tubes. For each sample you are processing, you will need: (i) One 2 ml round-bottom LoBind tube for gradient separation (ii) One 1.5 ml LoBind tube for washing nuclei (iii) One 2 ml Nunc Cryotube for banking extra nuclei (iv) One 50 ml conical for filtration step (often optional)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90v94","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Before you start the protocol:
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"81gub","text":"Prepare all buffers. For faster dissolution, crush protease inhibitor tablets prior to addition to 1x Homogenization Buffer Unstable Solution. DTT, Spermidine, and Spermine are stored at  . All other detergents, Multiome wash buffer, and other buffers are stored at  . Keep all buffers on ice. Do not prepare transposition mix ahead of time. Remember that the catalog number provided for Iodixanol from Sigma comes as a 60% solution (not 100%).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":187,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":266,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"es3vn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kcht","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"04BE2170C85711E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"13621","label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Before you start the protocol:
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2i7du","text":"Fill up a 2 L beaker with 500 ml sterile water to soak the used Dounces and pestles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bhkd8","text":"Remove samples from liquid nitrogen storage and keep on dry ice until use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3urjk","text":"Place 20 mg frozen tissue into a pre-chilled 2 ml Dounce containing 1 ml cold 1x HBUS and let thaw for   on ice. For \u003e30 mg tissue, use 2 ml 1x HBUS. For 10-20 mg tissue, use 1 ml 1x HBUS. For 50 um tissue sections, use 0.5 ml 1x HBUS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":103,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"01644810C85711E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"32770","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"508cb","text":"Dounce with “A” loose pestle until resistance goes away (~10 strokes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6gs6q","text":"Place “A” pestle into beaker with sterile water to soak for cleaning later. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"58fda","text":"Dounce with “B” tight pestle for 20 strokes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7dhcv","text":"Gently place the “B” pestle into a beaker with sterile water to soak for cleaning later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"60b6h","text":"Load the homogenate into a 1 mL pipette tip, affix a 70 um Flowmi strainer to the end of the tip, and transfer homogenate to a pre-chilled 2 ml LoBind tube. Repeat as necessary until all volume has been\nfiltered and transferred.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4hie1","text":"Place Dounce into beaker with sterile water to soak for cleaning later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dfq4a","text":"Pellet nuclei by spinning   at   at   in a fixed angle centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":31,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b54i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"F458BE30C85611E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"32771","label":"","preset":[]}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F6356D70C85611E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"13622","label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"350","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":1324}}}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ae1o","text":"Remove all but 50 ul of supernatant, which contains cytoplasmic components. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6shoh","text":"Gently resuspend nuclei in the required volume to give a total volume of 400 ul 1x HB. For example, if 50 ul was in the tube in the previous step, add 350 ul 1x HB. Make sure nuclei are fully resuspended without clumps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"asr92","text":"Add 1 volume (400 ul) of 50% Iodixanol Solution (with RNasin Plus RNase inhibitor) and mix well by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9va4v","text":"Slowly layer 600 ul of 30% Iodixanol solution (with RNasin Plus RNase inhibitor) under the 25% mixture. To avoid mixing of layers, wipe the side of the pipette tip with a Kimwipe to remove excess Iodixanol solution from the external surfaces of the pipette tip. To avoid bubbles, only push pipette to the first stop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7qnka","text":"Slowly layer 600 ul of 40% Iodixanol solution (with RNasin Plus RNase inhibitor) under the 30% mixture. To avoid mixing of layers, wipe the side of the pipette tip with a Kimwipe to remove excess Iodixanol solution from the external surfaces of the pipette tip. To avoid bubbles, only push pipette to the first stop.\t","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7jtjn","text":"In a pre-chilled swinging bucket centrifuge, spin for   at   at   with the brake off. Handle tubes gently so as to not disturb the gradient.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":59,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a3ndf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"EA242210C85611E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"32772","label":"","preset":[]}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"EC5CFB10C85611E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"13623","label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"3000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":1324}}}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ri9e","text":"Using a vacuum, aspirate the top layers down to within 200-300 ul of the nuclei band at the 30%-40% interface. Be careful not to get too close as you will disrupt the nuclei band.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9fg40","text":"Using a 200 ul volume, collect the nuclei band and transfer to a fresh tube. To do this, place the pipette tip just above the 30%-40% interface and carefully circle the tip back and forth while slowly releasing the plunger to “vacuum” up the nuclei band.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6378r","text":"Count the nuclei in each of the individual samples. Transfer 10 ul of the nuclei solution to a clean 1.5 mL tube and add 10 ul of Trypan Blue stain. Mix well by pipetting and load 10 uL into a disposable hemocytometer slide. An automatic cell counter compatible with Trypan Blue (such as the Countess) can also be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63g76","text":"Optional – If residual un-homogenized tissue makes it difficult to Dounce, filter homogenate through a 70 um bucket-style cell strainer filter into a pre-chilled 50 ml conical prior to using tight pestle “B”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"agv04","text":"During this step, you will need to gradually draw your pipette tip up to avoid overflowing the tube. However, the tip of your pipette must stay below the 30%-40% interface at all times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9jev8","text":"Iodixanol is meant to be used at higher speeds   but high-speed swinging bucket centrifuges are not always readily available so we perform this step at   and have not had any issues.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":152,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"725qg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":1324}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"3000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":1324}}}}

steps.section: Cleanup and Cryopreservation of Nuclei and Homogenate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eqibr","text":"If you would like to save extra nuclei for other assays or to potentially use in additional experiments downstream, you may follow these steps. However, we note that in our hands there is a statistically significant reduction in data quality when comparing freshly isolated and cryopreserved nuclei:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cleanup and Cryopreservation of Nuclei and Homogenate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ev94j","text":"Cleaning Dounces and pestles: Rinse all Dounces and pestles thoroughly with sterile water (2x) followed by 70% ethanol (2x). Let Dounces and pestles dry on a Kimwipe or paper towel for a few hours to overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cleanup and Cryopreservation of Nuclei and Homogenate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c9ril","text":"Pellet remaining nuclei by centrifugation for   at   at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":51,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"armav","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"C7753CD0C85711E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"32775","label":"","preset":[]}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":1324}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C3A52200C85711E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"13629","label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Cleanup and Cryopreservation of Nuclei and Homogenate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ehjl","text":"Carefully aspirate supernatant using two pipetting steps (p1000 then p200) as above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cleanup and Cryopreservation of Nuclei and Homogenate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ch5hs","text":"Gently resuspend nuclei pellet in 100 ul of cold BAM Banker media and transfer to a pre-chilled 2 ml Nunc cryovial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cleanup and Cryopreservation of Nuclei and Homogenate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bla7a","text":"Slow-freeze nuclei in a freezing container and move to   or liquid nitrogen storage the next day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"e9n6r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"BDAE56A0C85711E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"13630","label":"","temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"54eaa","text":"If the tissue you are using is fibrous or difficult to homogenize (for example heart, muscle, etc) then you may want to consider pre-crushing the tissue prior to Dounce homogenization. To do this, pre-chill a mortar and pestle on dry ice and use the pestle to break the tissue chunk into smaller pieces by repeatedly hitting the tissue. We don't recommend pulverizing the tissue into a powder - it should remain as small chunks. These small chunks may make it so that the Dounce gets stuck more frequently, but in our experience this pre-crushing can help liberate more nuclei from difficult tissues.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using Nuclei for Single-Nuclei Experiments with 10x Genomics after Freezing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"93nrf","text":"Thaw nuclei on ice or use directly after isolation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using Nuclei for Single-Nuclei Experiments with 10x Genomics after Freezing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"89ai9","text":"Aliquot desired number of nuclei into 1 mL of Multiome Wash Buffer in a 1.5 mL Lo-Bind microcentrifuge tube. The number of nuclei you use depends on the specific experiment. Gently invert the tube 5x.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using Nuclei for Single-Nuclei Experiments with 10x Genomics after Freezing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7q8vh","text":"Pellet at   at   for   in a fixed-angle rotor. You should be able to see a small pellet if you used more than 25,000 nuclei.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":15,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bulaf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":1324}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7D309AE0C85A11E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"13634","label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"7FB98FB0C85A11E984B5D3FAA41E56C0","id":"32779","label":"","preset":[]}}}}

steps.section: Using Nuclei for Single-Nuclei Experiments with 10x Genomics after Freezing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7u9c4","text":"Aspirate supernatant using 2 pipetting steps as above (p1000 then p200).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using Nuclei for Single-Nuclei Experiments with 10x Genomics after Freezing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6b88","text":"Resuspend nuclei in the desired volume of 1x Diluted Nuclei Buffer (use the same recipe as in the Materials section). Nuclei tend to clump more after freezing and thawing so addition of 1-2% BSA helps reduce clumping.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using Nuclei for Single-Nuclei Experiments with 10x Genomics after Freezing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dbar6","text":"Transfer 5 ul of nuclei suspension containing nuclei into 10 ul of transposition mix from the 10x protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using Nuclei for Single-Nuclei Experiments with 10x Genomics after Freezing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ajina","text":"Mix by pipetting, do not centrifuge or vortex and avoid introducing bubbles. Proceed to transposition incubation as indicated in the part of the 10x protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using Nuclei for Single-Nuclei Experiments with 10x Genomics after Freezing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4kaoo","text":"After this step, you will use 5 ul of nuclei in the transposition reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transposition of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"frb72","text":"From here, follow the steps in the 10x Genomics Chromium Next GEM Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression User Guide (CG000338). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aipdc","text":"Since the Multiome RNA-based assay will be performed on these nuclei, add 5 µL RNasin Plus RNase Inhibitor per mL of 1x HBUS as instructed in Same Day Buffers and mix well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e0p3g","text":"The exact number of strokes necessary is tissue-specific and should be optimized for each specific application, before performing it on all experimental conditions. The first time handling a new tissue, vary the number of strokes of pestle “B” between 10-25. The release of nuclei can be verified using a hemocytometer and Trypan Blue stain. Nuclei should appear as trypan positive spheres, amid the tissue debris. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cg98v","text":"If the pellet is not clearly visible or the remaining 50 uL are difficult to remove, more supernatant may be left in the tube. Up to 400 uL of the supernatant may be left behind, however, proportionally less\nof the 1x HBUS should be added in the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"36aek","text":"It is critical to use a swinging-bucket centrifuge for this step and to have the brake turned off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"95bj1","text":"Do not aspirate more than 200 ul at this step as this can cause you to take too much of the 40% layer which sometimes contains debris.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6tcoe","text":"Transfer the 200 uL of nuclei and add to 800 uL of Multiome Wash Buffer in pre-chilled 1.5 mL Lo-Bind Eppendorf tubes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5v7cb","text":"Filter the nuclei (1 mL) using a 1000 µL pipette tip and 40 µm Flowmi filter into the same 1.5 mL Lo-Bind  Eppendorf tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cv61q","text":"For samples potentially containing debris, using Trypan Blue may be difficult to distinguish nuclei from debris. In these instances, more accurate counts can be obtained using a fluorescent dye (ethidium homodimer-I) and a fluorescence compatible cell counter. Dilute the ethidium homodimer-I stock (1 mM) 1:100 and mix 10 µL of this with 10 µL of nuclei solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8b5pg","text":"If using a hemocytometer, count the number of intact nuclei in the 4 large corner squares. Take the total number in all 4 squares and multiply by 5000 to obtain the concentration of nuclei per mL. This\nis taken from the equation: (total cells counted)/(4 squares counted)*104*(dilution factor of 2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":274,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"er96j","text":"If using a fluorescence compatible cell counter (Countess 2 FL, Countess 3 FL, Cellaca MX FL5, Luna-FL, etc) and ethidium homodimer-I to count nuclei, take the RFP positive nuclei count.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c0bh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fl7tl","text":"Note: we have commonly used the Countess 3 FL for nuclei in Multiome assays. If using the Countess 3 FL for 10x Genomics Fixed RNA Profiling Assays (eg. RNA Flex Kits) we have experienced difficulties counting nuclei with fluorescent dyes post-probe hybridization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":264}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1at8e","text":"We recommend pooling nuclei samples prior to transposition (using human samples) to mitigate technical variability between reactions and running the pool across multiple channels of the 10x Genomics Multiome chip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7nnja","text":"This pooling strategy requires some genotype information for the individuals that are part of the pool to facilitate linking reads in the sequencing data back to the original samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6foqt","text":"If using human samples, we recommend pooling nuclei from different samples to avoid channel-to-channel technical variability that may confound downstream sample comparisons. Include equal proportions of nuclei in each sample to be included in the pool (if possible).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1jvbe","text":"Important: Do not include more than one sample from a particular individual in a pool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"12kp5","text":"Transfer nuclei from each individual sample to a pre-chilled 15 mL Falcon tube. Fill the Falcon tube on ice up to 15 mL using Multiome wash buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ah8l","text":"Mix the pooled nuclei in the high-volume wash (15 mL total) by inverting up and down 5 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3f4ki","text":"Centrifuge 15 mL Falcon tube for   at   at   in a pre-chilled large swinging bucket centrifuge. The nuclei pellet should be visible afterwards.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":38,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"76rpj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"250","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":1324}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ckler","text":"Prepare 1 mL of Diluted Nuclei Buffer (1X). Vortex briefly, spin down, and chill on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"61b2s","text":"The low-speed centrifugation reduces mechanical damage to the nuclei and nuclear membrane during the pelleting step. This helps prevent the nuclei from leaking valuable RNA signal. This also lowers ambient RNA levels from exogenous signals in the downstream single-nucleus RNA-seq data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3nei5","text":"If pooling samples in the 15 mL tube, carefully aspirate the supernatant down to 1 mL with a 10 mL serological pipette. Remove down to 200 uL with a p1000 pipette. Remove the last 200 uL with a p200 pipette very carefully without disturbing the nuclei pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2q593","text":"Resuspend pooled nuclei in 100 µL of Diluted Nuclei Buffer. This volume may differ depending on the targeted final nuclei concentration before transposition and the number of nuclei added to the high-volume wash. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rcsp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bm5i","text":"Pipette up and down 10 times gently on ice. Transfer the resuspended nuclei to a new, pre-chilled, 1.5 mL Lo-Bind Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1p7vi","text":"Transfer 10 µL of the nuclei solution to a clean 1.5 mL tube and add 10 µL of Trypan Blue stain. Mix well by pipetting and load into a disposable hemocytometer slide","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"co1ch","text":"If using Ethidium Homodimer, dilute the 1 mM stock solution 1:100. Mix 10 uL of the nuclei solution with 10 uL of Ethidium Homodimer and load into a disposable Countess Cell Counting slide. Let sit for at least one minute before loading into a fluorescent-capable Countess. Use the cell count displayed in the RFP channel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4v7hh","text":"Count the number of intact nuclei in the 4 large corner squares. Take the total number in all 4 squares and multiply by 5000 to obtain the concentration of nuclei per mL. Adjust this concentration to nuclei per ul before proceeding with the 10x Genomics Multiome protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fac7t","text":"If necessary, add more Diluted Nuclei Buffer (1X) to the nuclei to get to the desired concentration to start with the 10x Genomics Multiome protocol. We tend to overload the chip and dilute the nuclei to 5000 nuclei/uL. The final nuclei pool concentration may be different depending on the original samples and the specific experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bri49","text":"These nuclei are now ready to proceed with the ATAC transposition reaction as input to Step 1.1e of the 10x Genomics Multiome protocol. These nuclei can also be used for single-nucleus RNA-seq, single-nucleus ATAC-seq, and other epigenomic and transcriptomic assays. Nuclei can also be cryopreserved for later use as described below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":87,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c612q","text":"We typically add 5 ul volume of nuclei to the transposition reaction. Using a concentration of 5000 nuclei/ul corresponds to loading 25,000 nuclei per transposition reaction and well of the 10x Genomics chip. This is more than 10x Genomics recommends and is not officially supported by 10x Genomics. In our experience this concentration does not lead to more clogs in the 10x Chromium GEM Generation step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"rd3n","text":"This is intended to remove some of the debris from the nuclei samples. If working with samples with low nuclei counts, this step can be skipped if nuclei loss from the Flowmi filtration is a concern.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transposition of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fnrjv","text":"Prepare Transposition Mix containing the ATAC Buffer B (PN-2000193) and ATAC Enzyme B (PN-2000265/PN-2000272) kit on ice. Pipette mix 10x and centrifuge briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transposition of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d5mrq","text":"Add 10 ul Transposition Mix to a tube of a PCR 8-tube strip on ice for each sample. Briefly pulse centrifuge and maintain on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transposition of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9n6hs","text":"Confirm nuclei are at the correct concentration in Diluted Nuclei Buffer. This protocol uses 5000 nuclei/ul but other concentrations may be used depending on the experiment and starting sample amount.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transposition of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6bcsa","text":"Gently pipette the Nuclei Stock on ice immediately before adding to the transposition reaction. Add 5 ul of Nuclei Stock to the tube containing the Transposition Mix. Gently pipette mix 6x (pipette set to 10 ul). Do not centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transposition of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"610an","text":"For the transposition reaction incubate in a thermal cycler for   at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bi293","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv61","text":"On the thermal cycler program the lid temperature to be   and the reaction volume to be   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":88,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"50","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Transposition of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fla9h","text":"Proceed immediately with the subsequent steps of the 10x Genomics Chromium Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"esdc2","text":"The number of samples to pool and number of nuclei per individual sample to add to the pool depends on the specific experiment. For large cohorts with human postmortem samples we typically pool nuclei from 10-12 individual samples and add 200,000 nuclei to the pool. We account for nuclei loss due to the low-speed centrifugation and removing the resultant supernatant, even if very careful.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8u9pk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afgu8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"365o5","text":"In certain instances such as mouse samples, pooling different samples together will not be feasible. In these cases, process each sample individually through the single-nucleus Multiome protocol. If not pooling samples, perform an individual high-volume wash for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"884as","text":"We have had much success and similar data quality when loading 35,000 and 40,000 nuclei per transposition reaction and channel of the 10x Genomics Next GEM Chip J. This overloading assumes there is little to no debris in the final nuclei sample at this stage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Nuclei via Dounce Homogenization and Density Gradient Centrifugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cct64","text":"If using a standard, non-fluorescence automatic cell counter nuclei should stain and be labelled as \"dead\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling Samples and High Volume Wash of Nuclei
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2epkp","text":"The aim of this high-volume wash is to dilute out ambient RNA signals that are known to contaminate true signals once Gel Beads in Emulsions (GEMs) are formed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
